name: DataCrunch2015
body:
Thanks for participating in the NC Data4Good - DataCrunch for Social Good event.  Below are some resources for reference as well as curated datasets relevant to childhood hunger and food insecurity in the areas that the United Way of the Greater Triangle serve.

### Reference Material
List of resources on Childhood Hunger and Food Insecurity:
* [Hunger Research in NC] (http://hunger-research.sog.unc.edu/)
* [About School Meal Programs] (http://www.fns.usda.gov/school-meals/opportunity-schools)
* [Food Insecurity in Households With Children: Prevalence, Severity, and Household Characteristics, 2010-11] (http://www.ers.usda.gov/publications/eib-economic-information-bulletin/eib113/report-summary.aspx)
* [Food security trends] (http://www.ers.usda.gov/data-products/food-security-in-the-united-states/interactive-chart-food-security-trends.aspx)
* [Food security characteristics] (http://www.ers.usda.gov/data-products/food-security-in-the-united-states/interactive-chart-food-security-characteristics.aspx)

### Datasets
* [Food Pantries]

### Technical Documents
* [Data Visualization Checklist] (http://annkemery.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/05/DataVizChecklist_May2014.pdf)

### Contributors
Datasets cleaned and scrubbed by Monika Singh and Zeydy Ortiz

### Contact
This page maintained by Zeydy Ortiz (@DrZeydy)
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
